attributes.comment:
Dear Legislators,

We have recently adopted two healthy children from Russia. As I am sure you
are aware, the costs for adoption are rising both within and outside of the United
States. By rising, I mean rising at a rate in the 10 to 25% range per year. The
rate hikes proposed for the USCIS far exceed a reasonable amount in comparison
to the rates of inflation or increases of income levels of adopting families. While
increases seem inevitable, reason must be used to determine the amount.

I also want to remind legislators that our country relies on a growing economy, of
which, immigration is one way that our population grows. Legislation must
consciously continue to encourage births, adoption & legal immigration with the
long range affect of more consumers & a stronger economy. It is simple
economics. Our tax and fee systems need to look at the big picture so that we
have enough tax payers in the future. Short term costs are just that...short term.

Respectfully yours,

Andrea Loppnow
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Andrea Loppnow
